Cyber Security Resources

This page contains resources I recommend, on the topic of cyber security. If there on here, they have hit a high bar.

Websites

  • The Register. Great security news website, if you can get over the snarky language.
  • The Record. A good generic cyber security news website.
  • Project Zero. Hardcore technical write ups, of vulnerabilities and exploits on the cutting edge.
  • Citizen Lab. Some great articles on tradecraft by threat actors.

Podcasts

  • Security Now. I have been listening to this podcast since I started university in 2007.
  • Risky Biz. Great breaif 20min updates each week, on the latest news. I tend to skip the rest.
  • Darknet Diaries. Great stories. I recommend starting with the 2 part ‘xbox underground’ episodes.

Books

  • Building secure & reliable systems at google. A great book about security architecture at scale.
  • The Pheonix Project. A must read novel about a problamatic IT organisatoon, and how it was turned around.
  • Google Site Reliability Engineering. This book describes how google approaches the task of managing there IT infrastructure at scale.
  • A bug hunters diary. Follow how a security researcher finds vulnerabilities
  • Hacking, the art of exploitation. A bit out of date, but a must read intro to memory corruption vulnerabilities.

Articles

  • A linux back door attempt.
  • A guide to threat modelling.
  • Chinas great cannon.
  • The untold story of NotPetya.
  • A git horror story.
  • A zero day market case study.
  • Inside the world of legacy IT systems.
  • Fake COTS.
  • System design for advanced beginners.
  • Design docs at google.
  • Drawing good architecture diagrams.
  • What is technical debt.
  • How to write technical posts.
